U1R65iNg6sGkkl_2evAtlg.text: It's the service that earned only 2 stars and it's a shame because the food is well prepared and the menu interesting and varied.  However, they are so short staffed, it takes so long for someone to even bring us our drinks let alone take our order, that we are always on the verge of walking out before a server comes.   They also have a sign stating the hostess must seat everyone.  Hope you have a lot of extra time to wait for her to return to the front and seat you.  You will need it.

bD3FCHeC6RVim5YwV2x4nA.text: This is one of my favorite casual spots to eat at. I am here all the time. I love sitting outside or in the bar area. They have great salads and appetizers. I really love wine Wednesday's too. Fun casual and local spot to eat and chat with friends. They have great happy hour cocktail specials. I love the mojitos and frojitos as well.

DrCbl9AhGzYhiVLn5cNJAg.text: Fast service, good employees. Ordered the Turkey/Bacon roll. It was big but a little dry. Looks like they have lunch service down.

pPF0tJlLJX8SE_KK1CZjeg.text: Walnut Grill never disappoints! I have been here a handful of times, and there was always been great service and delicious food. The only problem I ever have is their menu is so extensive and offers such a wide variety that I have a hard time choosing what I want!  The chicken & artichoke sandwich (served open-face on a pita) is my go-to. In addition to a wide food menu, they also have an equally extensive drink menu - everything from beer and wine to martinis and Moscow mules. The strawberry-Bellini-tini is absolutely delicious if you're looking for a fancy drink to enjoy. It's not overly sweet and goes down too smooth (so be careful haha).   They also have a great happy hour from 5-7 PM, but it's only available if you sit in the bar area. There are nightly drink specials for the restaurant area though, too. Also, if you're a veteran or teacher there are certain days where they offer a discount or BOGO!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Chicken &amp; artichoke sandwich with sweet potato fries

KMeM3azIunw0rogZuXekdg.text: I met some coworkers at this Walnut Grill location this weekend for breakfast. The Yelp page (and Google) I think both say the restaurant opens at 11 on Saturdays, but we got there at 10:30 and it was already open! We were greeted and seated right away. Walnut Grill has a nice variety of breakfast/brunch options, so everyone in your party should be able to find something they like! I went with the DubG's lil plate and it came with two eggs, choice of breakfast meat, breakfast potatoes, and choice of toast. I also ordered a side of French toast because I had a taste for something sweet also!   Our food came out quickly and everything looked delicious! Sidenote- I ordered the bacon as my breakfast meat and it was thick cut, crispy pieces of heaven.. I could have eaten a whole plate of just that! And my side of french toast was two large pieces cut into four triangles. I had to take half of it home!  But overall, our waitress (Augusta) was awesome- she kept coming back to make sure our coffees and waters were full and the food was really good too! I would definitely come back here for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Side order of French Toast... wowza!
Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. DubG Lil&#39; Plate with eggs over hard, bacon, beeline potatoes and rye toast

DJt8nWdK9oagbfFkr4Yl4w.text: This place needs a good scrub. There were cobwebs and fruit flies everywhere. It smells like dirty mop water. The decor is dated and uninteresting (has been since day one). The food is decent but WAAAAYYY overpriced.  So disappointed.

MmUckb8kBaUUByO5cJmxrQ.text: Stopped at this location for late brunch. The flavor and portion of our food was very good. However, my eggs Benedict came out completely missing almost everything that was supposed to be on it (spinach, tomatoes) I didn't realize until I took my first bite and thought that it was definitely missing some pieces... the waiter had the kitchen heat up some tomatoes and spinach and brought them out to me on a separate plate. Torn between 2-3 stars, 3 stars because the menu is large and they may have room for redemption.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States

pbGi541X97kX9FkJzcGIVA.text: Below average food and atmosphere for high prices. Would not go again. At least the waitress was very nice. Id sooner go to an applebees than another walnut grille. It was also not very clean.

P9kiKingSProTEtNAX38fQ.text: What a dismissive place!  Our convention was being held that weekend.  We were on our own for dinner where Walnut Grill was a recommended spot for us to go.  Now there were 30 of us but the restaurant was not busy maybe 25% so we were a good ticket for the night as one would think.  It took them 1 hour to get to us to order.  We sat so long waiting it was ridiculous as we were wondering "when".  Our waitress took our drink orders but was slow there like I got my glass of wine, but water I had to ask 4 times.  We got bread after 1/2 hour.  We were 3 large tables.    What's sad is that the food was good.  I had the short ribs with a Caesar salad (upcharged), veggies and baked potato.  From what I saw from others' plates, their food was good.  Yet some others had to wait or didn't get what they ordered.  We had 1 1/2 year old and they didn't think she'd want food when an order was put in as she was the last to be served as we had to ask to feed the baby!  We were lucky as she was an incredible well behaved baby as that length of time could have led to a melt down.    When it came time for the check, we asked if they would offer an accommodation or some sort given what we went through as it was now 8:30 PM as we arrived 6:30 PM.  The manager said that length did not justify any accommodation.  Insult to injury - we got our checks as the restaurant was nice to do separate checks, but then they just plopped them on the table for us to sort and again when it was signature time.    I accept the fact that large parties are auto charged gratuity but the percentage should be based on what that party purchased.  They applied an across the board $4.98.  This meant someone who ordered a lot didn't pay an appropriate 18% and someone who ate light pad a percentage of up to 25% as one party just had a salad and water.    Such an unfortunate experience and to be dismissed like that for how we were treated.

OW3PEBSxarCKKsZOwWkT_Q.text: I ordered this food on DoorDash and it was the worst door dash delivery I've ever ordered. Mind you, I've ordered from Wendy's. WENDYS was a better option at a fraction of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. The &#34;Pittsburgh Salad&#34;. A despicable sight of what I ordered. Gross.
Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. I ordered the walnut salad and got one with feta and strawberries. Also, this was 7 bucks.

cbLCSxJbWr_0g-cfnE1vwQ.text: I haven't been here in a few years. I was anticipating a nice evening, but was poorly mistaken. The food itself was good. The wait and service that accompanied this food, was terrible. The server was no where to be found most of the evening. Never were we asked if we needed anything when our food was brought out. When i did ask for something, the food runner said they would "look and see and will be right back". They never came back. Resulting in me getting up to go to the bar to simply ask for my request. The amount of unprofessionalism with the servers and runners and hostess is astounding. I'm not one to be irritated when going to a restaurant as i am with this one. I've worked in the food industry and hospitality industry for years, this is an absolute embarrassment to the Walnut Grill chain. Better management is needed here.

5JGvYwjlOv2Jyudoh7J3uw.text: Yuck. Greeted by a host who asked where we wanted to be seated. Said dining room. Woman standing next to him said that someone had requested no more patrons be seated in the DR. Ok, fine, we will sit in the lounge. Took 30 mins for the bartender to take our order. I ordered the huevos rancheros. They came out with half the components listed on the menu missing and ringed by stale tortilla chips. Asked bartender, who had not checked on us, to have kitchen refire dish as described in menu. Wished I hadn't. Over easy eggs were underdone so the whites were snotty. Dish was now missing peppers, and topped with a guac so brown it could have been beef stew. Sausage was greasy crumbs. For the price this dish was actually offensive. Won't be back.

PvGFlbo0x2PbOYRq6jVFDQ.text: Such a good experience at Walnut Grill in Bridgeville! We went around noon for brunch and walked out an hour or so later feeling caffeinated and full to the brim of breakfast heaven.   Our server was attentive and bubbly, helpful and heavy handed with the coffee!  I ordered the Country Breakfast Bowl with the eggs scrambled - the ham wasn't overly salted, it was a skillet and the sausage gravy was served in a bowl on the side (I couldn't finish it all, but I didn't mind).  My friend got the chicken and waffles and was very pleased - there were lots of flavors involved, mainly because of the candied jalapenos and chipotle orange maple syrup.   At $11.99 and $12.99 I thought the prices were reasonable & I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Bridgeville - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Front: Country Breakfast Bowl (more of a skillet &amp; sausage gravy bowl)  Further Plate: Chicken and Waffles (more filling than it appears)

UwOUbPlNYV6cwNzNhz0_hw.text: So disappointed in this location. I used to love Walnut Grill when they first opened, but today I am doubtful that I'll ever return. My fiance and I decided to eat here on a whim, as I wanted their French onion soup terribly. When we were finally served (about half an hour after we ordered), the French onion soup was luke warm at best and EXTREMELY salty. I am not one to complain about food at all, but I couldn't even stomach to swallow it. About 20 minutes after they told me they would fix it, another server came back to my table and said, "it would all be from the same batch so here's stew." It's not that I wasn't appreciative that she tried to replace it, but I do not like stew. I would have much rather had a salad at that point, but that was never even offered as an option. Ultimately, the situation was never rectified, which is the reason for my dismay. Service was extremely slow and food was subpar at best.

BWj_O_G5Hfk43WX_lHx4bQ.text: Food was ok, ordered the crabcakes. Nothing special, just a couple golfball sized cakes. Ordered a drink which tasted watered down and was lacking ice. Waitress was more concerned with my husband's order and drink than mine. She asked him twice how his drink was and how his food was and never once acknowledged my empty glass or how my food was. First time here, never coming back.

7OjQbHop5LSW7zRNIG3z_g.text: I have been to both breakfast and lunch at this location-and neither experience was a good one. When my boyfriend and I went for breakfast we waited a really long time for our meals to come. Our server ended up taking care of our meals due to the wait time being so long. We went for dinner the other night, and they were out of several things on the menu. I ended up ordering a buffalo chicken wrap for dinner, and really did not enjoy it. I couldn't get myself to eat more than half of it. The food/food quality and service really seem to be lacking at this location. Don't plan on returning.

86MnAzGF9dB1rLTwRcYwEA.text: Ok so I was interested in tasting the Rivertowne Smoked Amber draft.  The bartender walks over to the tap and of course the keg is kicked.  He makes no attempt to replace the keg - just asks me if I want to try something else - uh, yeah like another place. Pretty disappointing.   I've given Walnut Grill a decent amount of personal and work related business.  Maybe it's the curse of the former Damon's?

gm69u7_IkixvxdkU-UYGXg.text: I went here last night for the first time and will never go back.  Service was terrible, waited an hour in half for our food, which wasn't that great.  Then the waitress never came back until we were almost done.  Took another half hour to get our bill.  Do not recommend this place!

q9Xj5T1wHdXKTi_Q1IUGHw.text: Stopped for lunch for the first time and probably the last. The dinning room layout and acoustics are not the best. Restroom down a long hall past the kitchen with no a/c in the men's room. By the way is a large screen tv necessary in front of the urinal?  Food was fare but over priced.  The service was slow and the waitress disappeared for most of the time. I like to get drink refills before your sucking the last bit of moisture out of the bottle of the glass!  And don't say " I'll be right back with your change" then go and wait another table!  I can pay a lot less for average.

m7fFL3nvYirPMr0gt4gkrg.text: I just hosted a surprise bridal shower for my sister at this location. I did it all over the phone since I don't live in town. They were very easy to work with and very accommodating. I called the hostess before we arrived to go over everything. They helped us pull off the surprise! We had a few selections on a personalized menu to choose from, and the food was good and came out very quickly after everyone ordered. For a very reasonable fee they also cut and served our cake. The waiters were extremely nice and efficient and took care of the many drink orders throughout the night quickly. We left behind balloons and other decor and they told us they would take care of it. We stayed about 20 minutes past closing and we were never rushed out of there. I would definitely host an event here again. Thank you!!

DE_9AmIUangeJmqicm10Aw.text: Very good service.  Food was fine though a little pricey.  Nice decor.

5DaOQY4ErI1axDBpKzdMDA.text: Worst brunch in Pittsburgh. The baked eggs looked and tasted like a fisher price kids kitchen toy. No one should feel comfortable serving something like that. The waitstaff was friendly, though, and kept the breakfast drinks flowing, so that's a plus, I guess.

8JxOEaFogMxRk45z8QqGlA.text: this experience was amazing, I have absolutely no complaints at all. the food was amazing and the restaurant was clean and the bathrooms were fantastic. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a great dining experience. Amber our server took very good care of us. everything came out in a timely manner and looked delicious. again I would recommend walnut grill to anyone looking for a great dining experience. definitely a great atmosphere.

52wbcF9sK1IFPEMd6A7WKQ.text: The place was pretty good. I think it wants to be slightly higher end than the average location. It was clean and nice ambiance. I had a top shelf margarita and it was much too sweet. I switched to beer after that. People behind the bar were not exceedingly friendly but that is ok. Had some appetizers and they were pretty good. Overall a place you should try at least once. I think our experience may have been on a bad service day.

4G0Hx2iMcnyrUydxv0zrcg.text: The service was top notch. You must try the pork nachos.  Dressings are all made in house and are very good.

JWQOarqs9zi78bE3PtRj9w.text: Ate here recently with my daughter, son-in-law and his parents.  We were in town for a visit. We thought we were going to have to have a long wait since it was busy and there were six of us, but they got us right in on the heated patio.  I ordered fish tacos and chose a baked sweet potato as my side.  They were delicious.  It was so much food.  I got three tacos and the sweet potato was HUGE. Everyone else at the table really enjoyed their meals.  Drinks were good and we were able order at happy hour prices for dinner. Waitress was very friendly and professional  Overall a good experience.

qUxrccqrX-d17ReUdji5tA.text: Went for dinner this past Sunday expecting the usual great food & service as we've had many times before but  were very disappointed! .  Started with onion soup  (great flavor but was  topped with lump of mozzarella cheese, awkward to enjoy) & also did chicken  quesoadilla. Huge portion as an app (plan to share! ) and is tasty but not great,  not a typical quesoadilla. For mains had the red snapper (ok but salsa way too spicy) and crab stuffed flounder  (crab stuffing  good but fish way over cooked.)  I had ordered the flounder & instead of usual sides requested  a small salad and veg special  (grilled asparagus.) Server nice but fussed, said asparagus would  be extra  $2.  Duh? Gee ok, fine...that's  what I'd like.  What  was very upsetting is when my entree arrived I was given a plate with the flounder, a baked sweet potato and something that looked  (and tasted ) like lawn clippings. Server said sorry, forgot the asparagus but can put that order in,will take  5 min.  I asked her to not bother,please  make sure we weren't charged. Upsetting because she didn't  offer  to correct my order  even when she noticed it was totally wrong &  darn,  never  got my salad!  Overall, very dissapointed  in the service & food. Have had good there in the past but do not plan to return.

sGc7OhGRKC-fuuamKR_yqQ.text: Never had a bad experience here. great, extensive food and drink menu. Clean place. They also have great specials for each day of the week!

atwjLHG8Py9keTVjkHYSqQ.text: My husband had my 50th birthday party there one week after it open. All I can say is the food was very good. The private room was set up so everyone could mingle. The service was outstanding!!! We had over 50 people there and we never had an empty glass and the food was continuously replenished . We will definitely be regulars.  Markus the manager was so accommodating, He has a great staff. I can't wait to go back.

lV1Hx55wOme5K-Srvi3IhQ.text: This place just opened last week so a coworker & I decided to try them out.  We were seated in the dining area.  The decor is quite nice.  The staff was very upbeat & friendly but, as my coworker put it, they have some kinks to still work out.  Shortly after we were seated, we had two different servers attempt to take our drink order.  There seemed to be some confusion over who was supposed to be handling our table.  After it was figured out, I ordered the flat bread chicken sandwich.  The flat bread was burned rather badly on the edges and underside.  Also it really did not resemble much of a "sandwich", it was more or less just piled on to the plate.  I was also told I'd have a refill as soon as the iced tea was done brewing but it never happened.    On the upside, the sweet potato fries were very good and my coworker's burger also looked very appetizing.  If you do visit, I would suggest trying to get seated in the bar area as it looked very open with a lot of natural lighting but would recommend you avoid the flat bread chicken sandwich.

5wi_7cAjerYPhMN2Wrd50w.text: Had eaten here two times and was moderately satisfied but had the General Manager pull up behind my car and give me a hard time about whether I was eating there or not...had never experienced that before and advised him with his attitude I'd never eat there again. No loss on my part as it's a very mediocre restaurant.

xQgG6jqErNs4F0NeAl4ITw.text: This is basically somewhat-upscale diner food.  We ended up here on New Years Eve (long story, but an emergency prevented us from getting to the restaurant where our original reservation was on time).  I was surprised at how many people chose to eat at this very casual establishment for NYE and the staff was slammed.  Our server had a terrible attitude.  My friend found a very long hair in her food and the server was very rude about it.  The manager came over and was appropriate.  I'd go back for a casual lunch or dinner but this is definitely not a special occasion place.

QSAXCgksNl4SPqMJ9_xCgg.text: Just left after waiting 20 minutes for our waitress to return and take our order.  Went to front desk to complain but they seemed not too concerned that we were leaving.  Have been to this restaurant for dinner at least twice a month in the last year and always enjoyed food and good service.  That will change as there are plenty of good restaurants that value a customer's time.  I will now go to the Walnut Grill once every 3 months.  Why patronize a restaurant that must not care about good service?

VBcmDTK9KHZwzPrvJTNNiw.text: Their food is great. I had the chicken and mushrooms in a light cream sauce and was pleasantly surprised. I only wish they had coupons or discounts, as their food is somewhat pricey.

ugZq47BG5fAhP5oYxTLKlg.text: We went for happy hour this weekend and we were greeted instantaniously as soon as we sat down. Our bartender Dan was super helpful with the beer selections and all of the specials that were going on. All of the other bartenders were on the ball as well, making sure we were never in need of anything. The food was out of this world. Major props to this business for being on the ball right out of the gates. We will definately be back!!

80GLKIL5Ui4vbFBmG0cKcQ.text: We had a great experience at Walnut Grille. We have actually been there a number of times. Food was good. Drinks are great. Great red and white sangria. The dining room was slightly chilly.

yxdp7HfybbrrzY6uqiV_0A.text: Love this place. Staff is friendly and food is delicious. Recommend the chicken with mushrooms, strip steak or gnocchi.  We have never left disappointed!

_2hQv9gUsMYced3yluQFIw.text: Just left the place because the service was horrible. This place used to be good. The beer selection also used to be good but now it seems they want to get rid of their winter beer and don't have any other micro brew selection.

AZPIzhpWlEDsxh-h4oF3Kg.text: It's just ok and very overpriced. I've tried 3 times because I wanted so badly to love it. I tried the balsamic glazed salmon in my last visit and it was dry and bland. My bill was over $30, for 1 meal and no alcohol. Way too expensive for a piece of dry dish.

hzsq_Q3azMwKfX5Xs73pHg.text: My girlfriend and I come here often and it's probably our go to restaurant right now. Food is always good as is the service. Reasonably priced, great atmosphere, and perfect location with plenty of parking.

5_YTmHFIDon94hRhiDdZXA.text: Another from the local group.  Recently opened with two dining areas and a large bar.  The bar is large and has about 10 TV's. 30 beers on tap.  Looks like a good bar to go to with a group. Ordered from the lunch entrees.  Parmesan Crusted Chicken & Gnocchi that has a tomato basil sauce with some chopped tomatoes.  The chicken was good, cooked just right with some nice taste of the Parmesan.   Waitress was good.  The place was not real busy since it just opened recently.

IQRlStaf7x_ho2Yv7KtqFQ.text: My review does not stem from the service or the food.  They were certainly adequate.  However, after settling the bill $17.66, and leaving, I checked my bank account on my phone and found they had charged me $17.66 and $82.66. (My Bill was for $17.66)  When I called the restaurant, TAD the manager could not have been more rude or arrogant. . I was told he didn't see it on his end so it wasn't True.  After nearly 30 minutes on the phone arguing my point, he found out through a call to his credit card company, I was indeed charged both of these amounts.  Upon checking with the server, he told TAD that he charged another person's bill to my card.  This was a debit account and these fund were missing from my checking account for nearly three day.  As a courtesy, TAD was to send me a gift card. This was on Tuesday, as of Saturday still no gift card. And again, the arrogance of TAD "well I don't know, I put it in the mail must be the post office's fault" was his reply. Seriously, there are many respected establishment in our city where you do NOT have to go through this type of inconvenience.  Reputable, restaurants who would not argue with you for 30 minutes, but would check, apologize, and make thing right.  Very disappointed in the very poor management of an otherwise nice restaurant .

JeuTzvdAh_k9pQah1cBXkQ.text: Happened to be nearby for business and was taken here. Definitely a solid option. Lots of flavorful and healthful options. Nice patio area for pleasant days (which this was). The service was nothing to write home about, but no real complaints. Basically exactly what you'd expect. I'd consider returning if I'm back in the area.

KKca9d7MvjmqxjkjdqpEbg.text: Wonderful atmosphere, very pleasant waitstaff, and delicious food.  I had the Blackened Salmon BLT with sweet potato fries and my wife had the Fish Tacos with a fresh field greens salad. She raved about both and I was very impressed with my meal as well. I will definitely be back again to try more of the menu.

GW7risxI-HanH6jXgiUbUA.text: Don't go for the Sunday brunch. The server Mike was great but the food was dreadful. Looked like leftovers they couldn't get rid of during the week. Much of it was inedible. At $17.95 they have nerve putting that stuff out

DSsu5PgUQFGT87E8pWPp8w.text: Always delicious, great service, and a nice atmosphere.  My girlfriend and I have become regulars.  We're never disappointed

S3GM_vF9E-Bheb3jSQG2GQ.text: I've always enjoyed Walnut Grill but the last few visits have been disappointing.  Tonight was the last straw.  My son came in from out of town to take me to dinner for my birthday.  I suggested Walnut Grill.  We were seated around 8:00 PM and with very little interaction from our server, our meal finally arrived around 9:15.  We both ordered the filet mignon and it was not worth the wait.  It was flavorless and not prepared as requested.  The server was apathetic at best.  Honestly, we both agreed that we have had better at Outback. It was a strange experience.  We were the only customers seated in the one section and it felt like we were forgotten about.  Our server was one of the least engaged I've ever had.  I wont be going back.  There are way too many other decent restaurants to visit.

qUmtUTvyXWklaEfZjzBKmQ.text: Slow slow slow service   No concern at all from employees about the length of time to have meal served.  I sat at the bar on a quiet Thursday evening and ordered dinner and a draft beer.  The beer was warm and I waited over 45 minutes and my meal never came.  Not one employee seemed concerned that I was sitting there with no food and was never even offered bread.  I finally asked to pay for my beer and ended up leaving without eating.   I shall never return to the Walnut Grille. I asked for the manager and after another five minutes he came over.  We spoke, he offered to buy my meal and I passed, he offered to buy my next meal and I passed.  I ended up leaving without eating and will not return.  Stopped at Sonic drive thru on way home and had my dinner in the car.  At least the food was hot and quick and the drink was cold.

9r9LHfNQjbbM2GgTfWIrBA.text: Came here on a Saturday night with friends. Highly recommend making reservations as it is a new restaurant in bridgeville.  Great selections and I highly suggest the tomato basil salad dressing. It is so good! Serve warm bread with specialty butters and always have drink specials. Saturday nights are $4 Long Island iced teas. Desserts are not too large and shouldn't be skipped over. Hoping to go soon for brunch! Oh and they have a take out menu!

my_uxxxREPosmNwnd6olFQ.text: Had a disappointing experience this evening after sitting for 20 minutes without a visit from waitstaff.  A couple seated in the booth across from us seemed to be struggling with a billing dispute and a coupon, but we were trying to be patient, but no one seemed to care that we were never asked for drink choices or brought bread.  We were looking forward to eating a nice meal as the menu had some interesting items, but we moved on because we were celebrating my mother's birthday and didn't want our evening spoiled.

sewVuDaah6mearu0Lnrtrg.text: Amazing food and service! The food is upscale bar food with a great atmosphere in either the dining or the bar areas. Good drink specials as well! Parking is a little rough on Fridays and Saturdays as it is Ina busy busy plaza.

_R-wLu1SYJsefECllJ6Jfg.text: Place was very friendly . I made a pit stop right after arriving in Pittsburgh from Houston . I had the crab cake with a side of sweet potato . Nothing too fancy but it did the job . The service was great and so was the butter that went with the sweet potato :)

mX8SpFxr_KaNtUjFGHoBHQ.text: ...had a function here with individuals at work and it turned out to be a great time. The food was excellent and the holiday beers flowed. We were positioned outside in a tented area which I thought was initially odd, but it was well heated and was a good barrier from the other patrons.

IC0LrLEvM_IT-gBVEL_Pgw.text: There's a reason that the other local Walnut Grill's have closed and based on my recent experience, I firmly believe this one is on the fast-track to follow suit.  First, it must be disclosed that on Mother's Day 2016, our party of six did not have a reservation.  With that said, our decision to visit the Walnut Grill was based upon an earlier phone call which confirmed the wait would be no more than one hour.  This was acceptable given the circumstances, and would give our party a chance to meet at the bar for cocktails anyway.  Upon arrival to a near-dead-empty restaurant, we were advised by the hostess that the wait would be 3 hours, unless we wanted to eat outside.  We saw that the patio (also empty as it was 60 degrees and falling) was equipped with heat lamps, so we opted to sit outside.  The hostess advised that we could simply let her know when we were ready to be seated after our cocktails at the bar, which we did approximately 30 minutes later.  The hostess then led us to a table on a different patio at the opposite side of the building near the front parking lot.  This patio offered no space heaters.  Despite these setbacks, we decided to stick it out and make the best of the situation, after all, we made it to a table at a restaurant on Mother's Day without reservations.  It's worth mentioning that we could see countless tables inside the restaurant that remained vacant throughout the duration of our visit.  After a brief wait, our waitress arrived with menus.  We spent about 15 minutes perusing the "special" Mother's Day Menu, which is different and dissimilar to the traditional Walnut Grill menu.  The waitress arrived and took our orders: 2 cedar-planked salmon and 4 NY strip steaks.  Approximately 20 minutes later, the waitress returned with a basket of bread, which she set on the table and again disappeared.  We had no place settings or plates so we were forced to wait for her return to ask for these items.  When we did, she brought 4 plates and 2 place settings while at the same time advising us that the kitchen had run out of NY strip steaks.  Disappointed, we all chose the next-most similar (but more expensive) menu item, the filet.  The waitress disappeared again, this time for around 45 minutes.  When she finally re-emerged, we politely asked how much longer we could expect to wait, especially for the soup that was ordered (over 1 hour ago).  She lazily advised that the wait would be at least 20 more minutes and that the soup for some bizarre unknown reason, would arrive with the entrees.  How she came up with the 20 minute estimation is anyone's guess.  At this point, we decided to re-evaluate our options and considered leaving, but believed we were close enough to the finish line that we opted to stay.  20 more long minutes later, our meals finally arrived, which in this case one would think would be a blessing.  I can only speak to the quality of my own meal, but will attest that nobody appeared overly excited about the food on their plates.  Unfortunately, my filet was cooked "medium", as was the preference when the original NY strip steak was ordered- my fault, I guess for not re-specifying, but nonetheless it was a bland slab of meat.  Nothing special about the baked potato or garden slaw.  Word about our table's long wait and unrest must have made its way to the restaurant's manager, as he arrived at our table to offer an apology- and a price reduction on our bill- a nice gesture, for which most of us were appreciative, but which was too little, too late.  This restaurant is a total mess- from the awkward, separationist floorplan to the bartenders' avoidance-of-eye contact policy to the trash-strewn restrooms- just an overall pretty terrible experience.  Not sure how long this place can last in it's state of mismanagement.  The waitress who served us was unacceptably untrained, which is a disappointment at a restaurant asking $26-38 per entree.  In my opinion, Walnut Grill has attemped to position itself as an "up-market" restaurant without first taking care of the small details that are to be expected of comparable restaurants.  No place of business can operate in the manner which the Walnut Grill does and expect to stay in business long. I predict this restaurant will be closed in the very near, if not immediate future.  Will not go back.
